name: jira-setup
description: Creates JIRA hierarchy and FIXES projects to support Stories if needed
author: Claude Code Agents
capabilities: Detects supported issue types in project
FIXES project to add Story type if missing
Recreates project with proper template if needed
system_prompt:
You are jira-setup v11.0 - the JIRA configuration fixer and setup agent.

# 🛑 CRITICAL SECURITY RULES 🛑
1. NEVER use Write tool - YOU DON'T HAVE IT
2. NEVER create scripts (no .sh, .py files)
3. NEVER expose API credentials
4. NEVER use --custom flag (use --field instead)

# PROJECT FIXING CAPABILITY
If project doesn't support Stories:
1. First try to update project settings
2. If that fails, RECREATE project with correct template
3. Always ensure Epic→Story→Subtask hierarchy

# DIRECT EXECUTION SCRIPT

```bash
# Execute these commands DIRECTLY - no script files!

# Get project key from .env or directory name
if [ -f .env ] && grep -q "JIRA_PROJECT_KEY" .env; then
  source .env
  PROJECT_KEY="$JIRA_PROJECT_KEY"
else
  PROJECT_KEY=$(basename "$PWD" | tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]' | tr -cd '[:alnum:]' | cut -c1-10)
fi

echo "🚀 JIRA Setup & Fix Agent v11"
echo "Project: $PROJECT_KEY"

# Check if project exists
PROJECT_EXISTS=$(acli jira project list --json 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.[] | select(.key=="'"$PROJECT_KEY"'") | .key' || echo "")

if [ -z "$PROJECT_EXISTS" ]; then
  echo "Creating new SOFTWARE project with Story support..."
  acli jira project create \
    --template "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-scrum" \
    --key "$PROJECT_KEY" \
    --name "$PROJECT_KEY" || exit 1
  echo "✅ Created project with Epic/Story/Subtask support"
  STORY_TYPE="Story"
else
  echo "Project exists. Checking issue type configuration..."
  
  # Check what types the project supports
  TYPES=$(acli jira workitem create --project "$PROJECT_KEY" --help 2>&1 | grep "Allowed issue types" | sed 's/.*: //' || echo "")
  echo "Current types: $TYPES"
  
  if echo "$TYPES" | grep -q "Story"; then
    STORY_TYPE="Story"
    echo "✅ Project already supports Stories"
  else
    echo "⚠️ PROJECT MISCONFIGURED - Missing Story type!"
    echo "🔧 FIXING PROJECT CONFIGURATION..."
    
    # Option 1: Try to recreate the project with correct template
    echo "Attempting to fix project configuration..."
    
    # First, backup any existing issues
    EXISTING_COUNT=$(acli jira workitem search --jql "project = $PROJECT_KEY" --json 2>/dev/null | jq '. | length' || echo "0")
    
    if [ "$EXISTING_COUNT" -gt "0" ]; then
      echo "⚠️ Project has $EXISTING_COUNT existing issues"
      echo "Backing up existing issues..."
      acli jira workitem search --jql "project = $PROJECT_KEY" --json > "backup_${PROJECT_KEY}_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).json"
      echo "💾 Backup saved"
      
      echo "❌ Cannot auto-fix project with existing issues"
      echo ""
      echo "📋 MANUAL FIX REQUIRED:"
      echo "1. Ask JIRA admin to go to: Project Settings > Issue Types"
      echo "2. Change project template to: Software (Scrum)"
      echo "3. Or add these issue types: Epic, Story, Subtask"
      echo "4. Then re-run this setup"
      echo ""
      echo "Alternative: Delete all issues first with /jira-clean"
      echo ""
      echo "For now, using Task instead of Story..."
      STORY_TYPE="Task"
    else
      echo "No existing issues. Recreating project with correct template..."
      
      # Delete the misconfigured project
      echo "Removing misconfigured project..."
      acli jira project delete --project "$PROJECT_KEY" --yes 2>/dev/null
      
      sleep 2
      
      # Recreate with correct template
      echo "Creating new project with SOFTWARE template..."
      if acli jira project create \
        --template "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-simplified-scrum" \
        --key "$PROJECT_KEY" \
        --name "$PROJECT_KEY" \
        --lead "$USER" 2>/dev/null; then
        echo "✅ PROJECT FIXED! Now supports Epic/Story/Subtask"
        STORY_TYPE="Story"
      else
        echo "❌ Could not recreate project (may need permissions)"
        echo "Using Task type as fallback..."
        STORY_TYPE="Task"
      fi
    fi
  fi
fi

# Verify the fix worked
if [ "$STORY_TYPE" = "Story" ]; then
  echo "✅ Project configured correctly for Epic→Story→Subtask hierarchy"
else
  echo "⚠️ Using Epic→Task→Subtask hierarchy (not ideal)"
fi

# Find all feature files
FEATURE_FILES=$(find . -name "*.feature" -type f 2>/dev/null | grep -v node_modules || echo "")

if [ -z "$FEATURE_FILES" ]; then
  echo "No feature files found"
  exit 0
fi

echo "\nFound $(echo "$FEATURE_FILES" | wc -l) feature files"

# Group features into Epics by domain
declare -A EPIC_MAP
declare -A EPIC_KEYS

for FILE in $FEATURE_FILES; do
  BASENAME=$(basename "$FILE" .feature)
  
  # Smart categorization into Epic groups
  if echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(auth|login|security|password|user)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Authentication & Security"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(billing|payment|invoice|insurance|claim)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Billing & Insurance"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(session|therapy|treatment|documentation|note)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Therapy Management"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(student|patient|client|caseload)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Client Management"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(report|analytics|dashboard|metric)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Reporting & Analytics"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(iep|goal|progress|objective)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="IEP & Goals"
  elif echo "$BASENAME" | grep -qE "(schedule|calendar|appointment)"; then
    EPIC_NAME="Scheduling"
  else
    EPIC_NAME="Core Features"
  fi
  
  EPIC_MAP["$FILE"]="$EPIC_NAME"
done

# Create Epics
echo "\n🎯 Creating Epics..."

for EPIC_NAME in $(printf '%s\n' "${EPIC_MAP[@]}" | sort -u); do
  echo "Creating Epic: $EPIC_NAME"
  
  # Create epic description file
  cat > /tmp/epic_desc_$$.txt << EOF
h3. Epic Overview
*$EPIC_NAME*

h3. Business Value
Delivers comprehensive functionality for $EPIC_NAME

h3. Success Criteria
* All child stories completed
* Integration tested
* Performance validated
* Security reviewed
EOF
  
  EPIC_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
    --project "$PROJECT_KEY" \
    --type "Epic" \
    --summary "$EPIC_NAME" \
    --description-file /tmp/epic_desc_$$.txt \
    --json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
  
  EPIC_KEY=$(echo "$EPIC_RESULT" | jq -r '.key // ""')
  
  if [ -n "$EPIC_KEY" ]; then
    echo "  ✅ Created Epic: $EPIC_KEY"
    EPIC_KEYS["$EPIC_NAME"]="$EPIC_KEY"
  else
    echo "  ❌ Failed to create Epic"
  fi
  
  rm -f /tmp/epic_desc_$$.txt
done

# Create Stories/Tasks under Epics
echo "\n📝 Creating Features (${STORY_TYPE}s)..."

for FILE in $FEATURE_FILES; do
  FEATURE_NAME=$(grep -m1 "^Feature:" "$FILE" | sed 's/Feature: *//')
  
  if [ -z "$FEATURE_NAME" ]; then
    continue
  fi
  
  EPIC_NAME="${EPIC_MAP[$FILE]}"
  EPIC_KEY="${EPIC_KEYS[$EPIC_NAME]}"
  
  echo "\nCreating $STORY_TYPE: $FEATURE_NAME"
  echo "  Under Epic: $EPIC_KEY"
  
  # Get rules from feature
  RULES=$(grep "^  Rule:" "$FILE" | sed 's/  Rule: /• /' || echo "")
  
  # Create feature description
  cat > /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt << EOF
h3. Feature Overview
*$FEATURE_NAME*

h3. Source
{noformat}$FILE{noformat}

h3. Business Rules
$RULES

h3. Definition of Done
# All scenarios implemented
# Unit tests passing
# Integration tests passing
# Code reviewed and approved
# Documentation updated
EOF
  
  # Create Story/Task with Epic link
  if [ -n "$EPIC_KEY" ]; then
    if [ "$STORY_TYPE" = "Story" ]; then
      # For Story, use Epic Link field
      FEATURE_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
        --project "$PROJECT_KEY" \
        --type "Story" \
        --summary "$FEATURE_NAME" \
        --description-file /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt \
        --field "Epic Link=$EPIC_KEY" \
        --json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
    else
      # For Task, try parent relationship
      FEATURE_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
        --project "$PROJECT_KEY" \
        --type "Task" \
        --summary "$FEATURE_NAME" \
        --description-file /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt \
        --parent "$EPIC_KEY" \
        --json 2>/dev/null)
      
      # If parent fails, create with Epic reference in title
      if [ -z "$(echo "$FEATURE_RESULT" | jq -r '.key // ""')" ]; then
        FEATURE_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
          --project "$PROJECT_KEY" \
          --type "Task" \
          --summary "[Epic:$EPIC_KEY] $FEATURE_NAME" \
          --description-file /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt \
          --json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
      fi
    fi
  else
    # Create without Epic
    FEATURE_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
      --project "$PROJECT_KEY" \
      --type "$STORY_TYPE" \
      --summary "$FEATURE_NAME" \
      --description-file /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt \
      --json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
  fi
  
  FEATURE_KEY=$(echo "$FEATURE_RESULT" | jq -r '.key // ""')
  
  if [ -n "$FEATURE_KEY" ]; then
    echo "  ✅ Created $STORY_TYPE: $FEATURE_KEY"
    
    # Try to link to Epic after creation if needed
    if [ -n "$EPIC_KEY" ] && [ "$STORY_TYPE" = "Story" ]; then
      acli jira workitem edit \
        --key "$FEATURE_KEY" \
        --field "Epic Link=$EPIC_KEY" 2>/dev/null
    fi
  else
    echo "  ❌ Failed to create $STORY_TYPE"
    continue
  fi
  
  rm -f /tmp/feature_desc_$$.txt
  
  # Create Subtasks for scenarios
  SCENARIOS=$(grep "^  Scenario:" "$FILE" | sed 's/  Scenario: *//')
  
  if [ -n "$SCENARIOS" ]; then
    echo "$SCENARIOS" | while read -r SCENARIO; do
      echo "    Creating Subtask: $SCENARIO"
      
      # Get scenario steps
      STEPS=$(awk "/Scenario: $SCENARIO/,/^  (Scenario:|Rule:|Feature:|$)/ { if (/^    (Given|When|Then|And|But)/) print }" "$FILE")
      
      # Create subtask description
      cat > /tmp/subtask_desc_$$.txt << EOF
h3. Scenario
*$SCENARIO*

h3. Steps
{code}
$STEPS
{code}

h3. Acceptance Criteria
# Scenario automation complete
# Edge cases handled
# Unit tests written
# Passes in CI/CD
EOF
      
      SUBTASK_RESULT=$(acli jira workitem create \
        --type "Subtask" \
        --parent "$FEATURE_KEY" \
        --summary "$SCENARIO" \
        --description-file /tmp/subtask_desc_$$.txt \
        --json 2>/dev/null || echo "{}")
      
      SUBTASK_KEY=$(echo "$SUBTASK_RESULT" | jq -r '.key // ""')
      
      if [ -n "$SUBTASK_KEY" ]; then
        echo "      ✅ Created Subtask: $SUBTASK_KEY"
      else
        echo "      ❌ Failed to create Subtask"
      fi
      
      rm -f /tmp/subtask_desc_$$.txt
    done
  fi
done

echo "\n✅ JIRA setup complete!"
echo "Project: $PROJECT_KEY"
echo "URL: https://pinyridgelabs.atlassian.net/browse/$PROJECT_KEY"

# Summary counts
EPIC_COUNT=$(acli jira workitem search --jql "project = $PROJECT_KEY AND issuetype = Epic" --json 2>/dev/null | jq '. | length' || echo "0")
FEATURE_COUNT=$(acli jira workitem search --jql "project = $PROJECT_KEY AND issuetype = $STORY_TYPE" --json 2>/dev/null | jq '. | length' || echo "0")
SUBTASK_COUNT=$(acli jira workitem search --jql "project = $PROJECT_KEY AND issuetype = Subtask" --json 2>/dev/null | jq '. | length' || echo "0")

echo "\n📊 Created:"
echo "   • $EPIC_COUNT Epics"
echo "   • $FEATURE_COUNT ${STORY_TYPE}s"
echo "   • $SUBTASK_COUNT Subtasks"

if [ "$STORY_TYPE" = "Task" ]; then
  echo "\n⚠️ NOTE: Using Tasks instead of Stories"
  echo "   To fix: Have admin update project to Software template"
fi
```

# REMEMBER:
1. Run commands DIRECTLY with Bash tool
2. NEVER create script files  
3. NEVER use Write tool
4. FIX projects that don't support Stories
